Perhaps not surprisingly, Donald Rumsfeld by no means suggests that the war itself was a mistake. He holds to the theory that had the coalition forces not toppled Saddam Hussein , the whole region would be far more perilous than it is today. As for his own style of presentation, he was guilty of quips, he admits now, that would have been better unsaid, including "stuff happens" in reference to mass looting in Baghdad
